Thanks Jim, a big thank you to all our volunteers. They were the best 
thin=
g about this shinsa.

Gordon

On =C3=B1=C3=BF=C3=B3j=C3=AC=CB=99, 9 23, 200=
4, at 12:45  PM, Jim Gilbert wrote:

> Milt,
> That design was used by seve=
ral groups.=C2=A0 As usual with iron guards, a 
> lot of the kantei comes i=
n seeing the characteristics of the metal and 
> its treatment in person.=
=C2=A0 The Kodai Hoan attribution came because the 
> raised edges around t=
he sukashi and mimi were formed by etching, a 
> characteristic of later Ho=
an work.=C2=A0 Also remember that Kodai (later 
> generation) Hoan is a dif=
ferent level of attribution than Hoan.=C2=A0 I'm 
> glad that you're happy =
with the attribution, I think it's a good one 
> and certainly a lot more f=
un than Shoami.
>
> It worked the other way on your dragon and Fuji-san tsu=
ba, which was 
> in Yanagawa style as you pointed out, but in person was no=
t up to the 
> level of Naoharu's work.=C2=A0 The dragon was very nicely ch=
iseled, but the 
> work was attributed to Mito Kinko, which matched my earl=
ier "internet 
> kantei" as I recall.
>
> Mr. Pink Shirt didn't get one of =
the highest point values, but his 
> guard by a very important maker did pa=
ss and was one of the highlights 
> of the shinsa.=C2=A0 It was a great day=
 for all concerned.=C2=A0 We had some 
> really fine pieces come through.
>=

> Milt, thanks for your hours manning the copy machine and outgoing 
> tab=
le.=C2=A0 This shinsa was a bit different and we couldn't have done it 
> w=
ithout the people who stepped up to the job.=C2=A0 Moses Becerra, Tom 
> He=
lm, Arnold Frenzel, John White, Fred Geyer and Bob Holcomb gave up 
> most =
or all of their "show time" to make the shinsa happen, including 
> some la=
te night and very early morning hours for a few on 
> Thursday/Friday.=C2=
=A0 I'm sure I'll kick myself soon for forgetting to 
> mention someone by =
name, but big thanks to all who did the work.
>
> Jim=C2=A0
>
>
>
> =C2=A0 =
Jim,
>
> =C2=A0 please klick...........
>
> =C2=A0 http://tinyurl.com/7xc7z=

>
> =C2=A0 I am quite=C2=A0 pleasantly surprised that the tsuba was given =
an
> =C2=A0 attribution of " mid edo Hoan " by the shinsa team headed by Ha=
gihara
> =C2=A0 sensei.
> =C2=A0 I recall we discussed this tsuba long time=
 ago on this list that this
> =C2=A0 is most likely=C2=A0 a Shoami on an av=
erage day or a Umetada ( or
> =C2=A0 Myochin ) on a very very good day.
>
>=
 =C2=A0 You mentioned briefly that it has something to do with the beveling=

> =C2=A0 of the guard which I don't quite understand. Can you elaborate on=

> =C2=A0 that ?
>
> =C2=A0 Thanks........
>
> =C2=A0 p.s.=C2=A0 Just found=
 out from an old timer that it is indeed good luck to
> =C2=A0 wear pink on=
 shinsa day.
> =C2=A0 That guy in pink tee shirt submitted one of the highe=
st point score
> =C2=A0 tsuba !!
>
> =C2=A0 Milt
